intro: Fimbristylis neglecta, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats such as swamps, marshes, and along waterways. It has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Fimbristylis neglecta is often found in disturbed or nutrient-rich soils and is an important component of wetland ecosystems.
